characters.name: Thomas Jefferson
characters.title: Primary Author of the Declaration
characters.bio: Virginia delegate and primary drafter of the Declaration. Lodged at Jacob Graff Jr.'s house while crafting the document that would change history.
characters.role: Committee of Five member, primary author
historical_notes: Wrote the first draft in his lodgings at Graff House
Made weather observations including temperature readings
Revised the draft based on committee feedback

characters.name: John Adams
characters.title: Massachusetts Delegate
characters.bio: Passionate advocate for independence from Massachusetts. Stayed at Mrs. Yard's boarding house during the Continental Congress sessions.
characters.role: Committee of Five member, independence advocate
historical_notes: Strong advocate for independence in Continental Congress
Maintained extensive correspondence with wife Abigail
Stayed at boarding house on Second Street during Congress

characters.name: Benjamin Franklin
characters.title: Pennsylvania Delegate & Elder Statesman
characters.bio: Renowned philosopher, inventor, and diplomat. At 70, the oldest signer, bringing wisdom and wit to the proceedings from his Philadelphia home.
characters.role: Committee of Five member, elder statesman
historical_notes: Made few but significant edits to Jefferson's draft
Lived at his Philadelphia home Franklin Court

characters.name: Timothy Matlack
characters.title: Engrossing Clerk
characters.bio: The skilled penman who engrossed the final parchment copy. Not a delegate but essential to creating the document we see today.
historical_notes: Professional penman responsible for the engrossed copy
Used high-quality parchment and special inks
Not a delegate but crucial to the signing process
